did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Address Before the Farmers, Fruit and Stock Growers of Arizona, October 18, 1895
did.abstract: Louis C. Hughes, 1844-1915 was an Arizona pioneer, lawyer, newspaper publisher, and politician. This collection includes a typescript of an address by Hughes, before the meeting of the Farmers, Fruit and Stock Growers of Arizona, Oct. 18, 1895, on the occasion of its organization.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Address Before the Farmers, Fruit and Stock Growers of Arizona (AZ 203). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Arizona pioneer; lawyer, newspaper publisher, and politician. Hughes established the Arizona Daily Star in 1877 and published it until his death. He served as district attorney, probate judge, attorney general for Arizona, U.S. Court Commissioner, Governor of Arizona, 1893-1896, and chancellor of the Board of Regents, 1897-1898.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into narrative sequence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Typescript of address by Hughes, before the meeting of the Farmers, Fruit and Stock Growers of Arizona, Oct. 18, 1895, on the occasion of its organization.

relatedmaterial.p: Materials relating to Louis Hughes may also be found in Docket of Preliminary Hearings (AZ 202).
